member.name: T:Microsoft.Fabric.Relay.Connections.Services.IMwcPlatformHttpClientProvider
member.summary: Client for MWC.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fabric.Relay.Connections.Services.IMwcPlatformHttpClientProvider.InitializeFrontendEndpoint(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize provider with MWC frontend base endpoint.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fabric.Relay.Connections.Services.IMwcPlatformHttpClientProvider.InitializeOrchestratorEndpoint(System.String,Microsoft.Fabric.Relay.AzureRelayAuthInfo)
member.summary: Initialize provider with the endpoint for hitting orchestrator through the azure relay
member.remarks: What should be provided here is exactly what comes back in the registration response for PlatformApiUri. This has not just the base address for getting through the relay but also the extra path segment for reaching the dev mode workload health check controller /endpoint/Microsoft.Fabric.Platform For the first-party use case where this same class is used to create http clients for reaching other internal endpoints on orchestrator, we strip off that extra path internally.
member.param: Object containing the service bus key name and key for accessing orchestrator through the relay

member.summary: Initialize provider with PbiShared base endpoint.

member.param: The original orchestrator base address which should be replaced with the relay address
